text.0: great art thou agni sacrifices herald not without thee are deathless gods made joyful.
text.1: come hither with all deities about thee here take thy seat the first as priest o agni.
text.2: men with oblations evermore entreat thee the swift to undertake an envoys duty.
text.3: he on whose sacred grass with gods thou sittest to him o agni are the days propitious.
text.4: three times a day in thee are shown the treasures sent for the mortal who presents oblation.
text.5: bring the gods hither like a man o agni be thou our envoy guarding us from curses.
text.6: lord of the lofty sacrifice is agni agni is lord of every gift presented.
text.7: the vasus were contented with his wisdom so the gods made him their oblationbearer.
text.8: o agni bring the gods to taste our presents with indra leading here let them be joyful.
text.9: convey this sacrifice to gods in heaven ye gods preserve us evermore with blessings.
